title: Director, Google Cloud Platform
description: Director Google Cloud Platform United States  Canada  Work from home  Remote  LIRemote Why You Do you have strong experience with the cloudAre you able to lead a practice that bridges the gap between business finance and the technical sides of our customers businesses to optimize their cloud strategy Are you a compelling communicator and a natural motivator Can you get the very best from enthusiastic teams of experts whose professional growth you nurture At Pythian we believe Google Cloud is a key platform for driving business transformations for our customers This commitment means were a Google Premier Partner and take responsibility for ambitious transformation projects Can you help transform how our customers compete and win by helping them use their data to power their business and turn their data into valuable insights predictions and products to help them deliver better outcomes faster If you Love Your Data and want to Love Your Career then this could be the job for you What will you be doing Youll own and manage all aspects of the Google Cloud Practice building and executing on a business plan aligned with Pythians broader Google business goals Support Pythians customer adoption of Google Cloud services like Google Compute Engine Resource Manager Google Kubernetes Engine BigQuery Security Command Center and many more Managing and building the GCP team to achieve utilization goals driving accountability through appropriate metrics and performance expectations for each team member as they work with our customers and their teams to support and guide issuesescalations to resolution Developing strategies to ensure a high level of customer  revenue retention helping customers understand the opportunities for cloud optimisation rightsizing automation and their cost saving abilities Conduct regular touchpoints with customers to review their cloud strategy and provide updates on best practices and provide Google Cloud product updates Attend quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs Plan for customer events and launches work with Support Engineering and Site Reliability Engineering to ensure customer success during critical moments Mature our GCP offerings and developing and maturing the practices core processes Effectively resolve issues across the marketingsales and customer success functions  being comfortable with conflict addressing issues and solving problems in a practical and healthy manner Maintaining and developing strong relationships with Google that help shape Pythians practices and offerings to expand customer use of GCP andor offer Pythianled infrastructure data and application development projects What do we need from you This is a wish list and there will be plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and contribute to the Team and Customers needs and grow with Pythian While we realize you might not have everything to be the successful candidate for the Director job you will likely have skills such as Passion and knowledge in cloud resell and support offerings across key cloud platforms ideally with strong knowledge of Google Cloud but Microsoft Azure or AWS would work as well Knowledge of cloud economics and value realization frameworks processes and solutions to optimize cloud consumption and maximize value would be greatly appreciated Strong consulting experience in both business development and engagement delivery gained with a professional services or systems integration firm Proven ability to manage customer engagements under high stress to successful completion Be a strong problem solver and creative thinker with gravitas and strong negotiation skills Have the ability to operate at the strategic level yet being close enough to the details to add value to Pythians customers and be a real support to your team Exceptional leadershipmanagement skills effectively managing both up and down With a track record of leading teams to success A desire to learn  expand your comfort zone whenever a new technological trends in the Hyperscale cloud space arises Additional Information Why Pythian Pythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this everchanging environment by delivering advanced onprem hybrid cloud and multicloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else Founded and headquartered in Ottawa Canada in 1997 Pythian now has more than 450 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS media gaming financial services ecommerce and more Pythian is known for its technologyenabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS Google and Microsoft The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and largesized businesses transform to stay ahead in todays rapidly changing digital economy If you are a Director of Cloud Operations or Infrastructure live in the US or Canada love your data and want to love your career then join us Disclaimer For this job an equivalent combination of education and experience which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check Applicants must be legally authorized to work in their country of residence permanently Pythian will not relocate sponsor or file petitions of any kind on behalf of a foreign worker to gain a work visa become a permanent resident based on a permanent job offer or to otherwise obtain authorization to work Love Your Data title: Consultant Penetration Tester | Remote US
description: About Coalfire Coalfire is on a mission to make the world a safer place by solving our clients toughest cybersecurity challenges We work at the cutting edge of technology to advise assess automate and ultimately help companies navigate the everchanging cybersecurity landscape We are headquartered in Denver Colorado with offices across the US and UK and we support clients around the world But thats not who we are thats just what we do We are thought leaders consultants and cybersecurity experts but above all else we are a team of passionate problemsolvers who are hungry to learn grow and make a difference And were growing fast Were looking for a Consultant to support our Pentesting Team  open to remote locations in the US Position Summary Working independently and collaboratively with a team to support the following work activities where skills apply such as Internal and External Network Penetration Testing Application Penetration Testing Browserbased API Mobile Cloud Solution Penetration Testing Social Engineering Wireless Assessments Conduct security assessments on a wide variety of technologies and implementations Simulate sophisticated cyberattacks for clients worldwide What Youll Do Advises clients on technical security or compliance activities Manages priorities and tasks to achieve delivery utilization targets Operates with professionalism both internally and with clients Ensures quality products and services are delivered on time Continues to develop professional skills with relevant industry specific certifications Maintains strong depth of knowledge in the practice area Collaborates with project managers quality management sales and other delivery team members to drive customer satisfaction and meet project deliverables Develop processes procedures and methodologies to enhance testing processes and experience Assist with report generation and quality assurance processes Develop client relationships Assist in the scoping of prospective engagements leading engagements from initial stages through implementation and remediation Manage project escalations of current testing being conducted Mentor and develop less experienced staff Contribute to the Coalfire Threat and Vulnerability Management Team overall success by managing your team to meet various business objectives and metrics What Youll Bring Bachelors degree fouryear college or university or equivalent combination of education and work experience 3 years experience in information security with network penetration testing experience Handson experience with scripting languages such as Python Powershell Shell or Ruby Experience with one or more IT security compliance frameworks such as PCI FISMA HIPAA FEDRAMP or HITRUST One to three 13 years of experience in an IT Security Audit andor Compliance role Experience interacting with management in a consultative manner Strong IT understanding with respect to networks servers workstations and applications Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to travel up to 20 Bonus Points Deep experience engaging clientele in consultingrelated environments Experience leading penetration team engagements Reverse engineering malware data obfuscators or ciphers An aptitude for technical writing including assessment reports presentations and operating procedures Strong understanding of security principles policies and industry best practices Additional Information Why Youll Want to Join Us At Coalfire youll find the support you need to thrive personally and professionally In many cases we provide a flexible work model that empowers you to choose when and where youll work most effectively whether youre at home or an office Regardless of location youll experience a company that prioritizes connection and wellbeing and be part of a team where people care about each other and our communities Youll have opportunities to join employee resource groups participate in inperson and virtual events and more And youll enjoy competitive perks and benefits to support you and your family like flexible time off certification and training reimbursement and comprehensive insurance options At Coalfire equal opportunity and pay equity is integral to the way we do business A reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role is 64000 to 112000 based on national salary averages The actual salary offer to the successful candidate will be based on jobrelated education geographic location training licensure and certifications and other factors You may also be eligible to participate in annual incentive commission andor recognition programs LIRemote LIGB1

description: Curology is creating the next generation of skincare through customized treatment plans and formulas with powerful prescription ingredients for acne and antiaging We believe great skin shouldnt be a luxury but a fact of life Performance marketing is a key driver of Curologys success We have built a robust direct marketing program and are now looking for a Senior Director who can build on our success and take performance to the next level We are seeking a team leader that has deep handson marketing experience loves to develop top talent and has shown the ability to drive scale in a costeffective manner Your work will be critical to Curologys continued growth and you will have the opportunity to help shape the business in key ways through our marketing campaigns Responsibilities Develop and execute a comprehensive customer acquisition strategy aligned with the companys overall business goals and growth targets for both the Curology and Agency brands Manage acquisition budgets and allocate resources effectively to maximize results and meet acquisition targets Manage tactic allocation outcomes and media pacing ensuring goals are achieved and media efficiency is maximized Identify evaluate and launch new acquisition channels and opportunities to expand the customer base and drive revenue growth Consistently innovate by leveraging internal market research and insights as well as the latest trends and developments in customer acquisition to inform acquisition strategies and tactics Monitor and examine key performance indicators KPIs related to customer acquisition such as cost per acquisition CPA conversion rates customer lifetime value CLV and work with team members to optimize campaigns and improve performance leverage both LTA and MMM attribution models Build Aclass growth technology stack attribution bidding automation analytics tools creative and campaign automation etc Oversee the growth creative studio delivering effective creative that meets business goalsUtilize customer analytics and segmentation to personalize and optimize acquisition campaigns targeting the right audience with the right messaging at the right time Stay uptodate with industry trends emerging technologies and best practices in customer acquisition and apply insights to enhance acquisition strategies and tactics Develop and maintain relationships with external vendors agencies and technology partners to leverage their expertise tools and platforms for optimal acquisition campaign execution Provide regular reports and presentations to senior hardest cyber risk challenges with worldclass analytics Our team is composed of multidisciplinary experts across data science cyber security software engineering modeling and commercial insurance CyberCube offers products for cyber risk aggregation modeling and insurance underwriting CyberCube leverages the threat intelligence from the worlds leading cyber security company Symantec along with several other data sources CyberCube is headquartered in San Francisco California We are backed by ForgePoint Capital the worlds largest venture capital fund dedicated to cyber security early stage investing HSCM premier insurance and insurtech investor and Symantec Ventures About the Role CyberCube is looking for an experienced Product Manager to lead the execution of our data platform products team working in collaboration with our analytics engineering  design teams Your role will be to execute and advise on the roadmap for data platform products while taking input from customers and from developing new product strategies to rolling out solutions You will discover the fundamental needs of multiple stakeholders set priorities and create requirements to build upon CyberCubes leading unlimited PTO and meaningful early stage equity Generous healthcare benefits with medical dental and vision coverage Companypaid learning and development assistance Grow in a collaborative respectful and empathetic culture Responsibilities Define requirements by learning from customers and working closely with our engineering analytics and data teams Motivate those building solutions with a deep understanding of the why and the what inspiring their ownership of the how Conduct market research and competitive analysis anticipating customer needs and crafting a compelling narrative around new features use cases or markets Manage the roadmap in a clear consistent manner and help everyone understand what success looks like for any product feature or design change Coordinate crossfunctional inbound activities across functional team leads and team contributors Establish time schedules and develop wellintegrated plans managing projects through from commitment to delivery Perform data analyses on industry data product telemetry data from our products etc to help inform product decisions and support customers Work crossfunctionally with our Marketing  PRCommunications teams to create product collateral and support go to market efforts About you Youve previously demonstrated success as a B2B Product Manager Experience with cyber security cyber insurance or other related industries is a definite plus Love of APIs and data Youre excited about thinking bigpicture strategy but are equally excited to roll up your sleeves and put together requirements docs technical documentation and value proposition statements as well as run standups groom backlogs and conduct retrospectives You lead through influence without the need for direct authority You have the proven ability to motivate lead and collaborate with crossfunctional teams You rely on data to drive your decision making and strategy Youve worked in an agile environment before and will ideally be comfortable with Jira Confluence Asana etc You have intellectual curiosity willingness to learn new skills and ability to contribute ideas Youre excited by analytical problems and new challenges Skills and Qualification Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field or equivalent experience MBA or Masters Degree a plus At least 5 years of product management experience with a focus in risk management and insurance or other financial industry bonus points for cyber experience You have successfully demonstrated the ability to define and ship products in an iterative manner and take an earlystage product to the next level with new functionality that is broadly utilized across a customer base andor internal teams Thinking product requirements and product launch plans is second nature best work Today we provide a dynamic cloudbased platform for work execution empowering organizations to plan capture track automate and report on work at scale resulting in more efficient processes and better business outcomes This position is remote eligible and reports to the Sr Director Operations in Costa Rica You Will Design and develop automated reporting solutions and dashboards to enable title: Freelance Artist-Illustrator
description: We enable advertisers performance campaigns with timely powerful ad creatives that deliver Creative ROI Our global network of creative centers of excellence specializes in high technology creative production such as CGI We are known for worldclass ideation and creative production through our network of talented creative hubs as human creativity cannot be supplanted by machines Some of the worlds largest online advertisers work with us to improve their campaigns leveraging performance design We are looking for a Freelance Concept artistIllustrator to work in a production environment creating designs for various gaming projects We are looking for a strong digital illustrator who can work in a variety of different styles and is forwardthinking You will work independently and as part of a team and should be comfortable creating original art as well as working with licensed art Responsibilities Digital Paintovers Utilize your expertise in digital painting to improve and refine existing digitally composed assets concept art character designs environments props and other game assets Apply your artistic eye to enhance the overall visual appeal composition lighting color and mood Collaboration and Communication Work closely with our creative team including 3D artists project managers and art directors to understand project requirements vision and artistic direction Effectively communicate your ideas and suggestions to ensure alignment with the projects visual style and objectives Gaming Industry Knowledge Bring your deep understanding of the gaming industry including current trends art styles and technical requirements Adaptability and Iteration Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability in responding to feedback and making revisions to your work Collaborate closely with the team to iterate based on art direction and client feedback Timely Delivery Meet project deadlines and manage your time effectively to deliver highquality paintovers within the specified timelines Coordinate with the team to ensure a smooth workflow and maintain clear communication regarding project status Qualifications Mastery of traditional art skills including form language color theory environment sketching and design figure drawing technical drawing Expert in the use of PhotoshopPainter as well as traditional paintingrendering techniques Extensive portfolio with examples of current handson work including concept art production designs storyboards and other visual images that demonstrate complex artistic goals in simple to follow visual images Works independently and conscientiously with minimal supervision 7 years of experience in a production environment filmtvgames Strong understanding of general 3D and game art production techniques Some understanding of 3D modeling software and using initial mockups or manipulate existing 3D files a plus Additional Information Creadits team is comprised of datadriven innovators and disrupters We think creatively work efficiently and contribute consistently Our people are located in Austin Denmark Los Angeles London New York Singapore Tokyo and Ukraine and are all passionate about our work and our product

title: Product Marketing Manager, Sounds & Surfaces (Remote)
description: JOB TITLE Product Marketing Manager Sounds  Surfaces LOCATION Remote THE ROLE We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to champion our Sounds business and market products to our customers in an inspirational and creatorcentric way The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator with a proactive attitude and a deep knowledge of todays musicmaking landscape WHO WE ARE We are a producers playground delivering music creators the tools they need to bring their ideas to life With a massive industryleading catalog of licensed samples paired with powerful AI and access to affordable plugins and DAWs Splice kicks sound discovery inspiration and creative output into overdrive HOW WE WORK At Splice DISCO is a rallying cry for collaboration accountability and unity within our organization Direct Inclusive Splice Together Creator Centric and Optimistic Our shared success depends on our ability to support one another work well together and communicate directly By embracing flexibility and a unified approach we can navigate anything thats thrown at us Splice embraces a culture of remote work Youll see your colleagues showing up from across the US and the UK In order to keep us working well as a team we have regular communication including Town Halls departmental All Hands and gettogethers When you join Splice you join a network of colleagues peers and collaborators Are you ready WHAT YOULL DO You will be responsible for bringing the worldclass Splice Sounds product to market as well as promoting Splices various surfaces including Desktop Bridge and the Splice Mobile and CoSo apps to the ever expanding music creation community Youll also help drive the marketing activities for the latest AIpowered technologies that keep Splice at the forefront of the music creation market You will work with Product Managers and the Director of Product Marketing to define overall product strategy establish timelines for GTM and collaborate with your marketing peers to establish comprehensive channel plans You will play a linchpin role in product launches drive a constant drumbeat of product announcements and take a datadriven approach to reporting on the success of product marketing activities JOB REQUIREMENTS 3 years experience in product marketing and GTM activities Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach to crossfunctional work A userfocused attitude with a dedication to Splice subscribers and future customers A strong background in music production whether professional or as a hobbyist Clear understanding of Splices place in the industry In accordance with New York law the salary range for this role if filled within New York is 117500  142500 Equal Opportunity Employer Splice provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race color religion age sex national origin disability status genetics protected veteran status sexual orientation gender identity or expression or any other characteristic protected by federal state or local laws

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description: At SonderMind we know that therapy works SonderMind provides accessible personalized mental health care that produces highquality outcomes for individuals SonderMinds individualized approach to care starts with using innovative technology to help people not just find a therapist but find the right innetwork therapist for them How youll make an impact The Executive Assistant to the CEO will provide dedicated executive support to ensure optimal operational efficiency The individual will be primarily responsible for overseeing all aspects of the CEOs daytoday activities as well as communicating with internal and external parties coordinating essential projects and events and anticipating the CEOs needs The ideal candidate must possess exceptional organizational skills meticulous attention to detail high degree of comfort with change and ambiguity and a proactive mindset The individual must demonstrate the ability to adapt quickly to new challenges and effectively manage shifting priorities and schedules The individual must maintain an extremely positive attitude and exhibit the highest level of responsiveness This role requires strong written and verbal communication skills as well as excellent administrative and organizational abilities What youll do Efficiently manage and maintain the CEOs professional and personal calendars ensuring accurate scheduling of appointments meetings and eventsSkillfully coordinate complex travel arrangements encompassing flight bookings accommodations and transportation logistics Demonstrate exceptional problemsolving skills by proactively anticipating the needs of the CEO and providing timely support Effectively collaborate and maintain close coordination with fellow executive assistants to ensure alignment of priorities and streamline operational efforts Coordinate and provide comprehensive support for all company events and programs encompassing meticulous planning and logistics efficient scheduling and communication and seamless onsite coordination Thoroughly review and reconcile monthly credit card statements to ensure the accurate and timely submission of expense reimbursements Support complex family arrangements personal projects and external professional engagements including coordinating events scheduling transportation coordination engagement and serving as primary point for external vendors contractors What youll bring with you Required Experience Bachelors degree Proven experience that demonstrates the ability to seamlessly perform and prioritize multiple tasks with excellent attention to detail Referenceable exceptional interpersonal skills and success cultivating relationships with various stakeholders such as board members external partners and investors Past roles that required management of confidential information with utmost discretion adaptability around competing demands and demonstrated ability to consistently provide the highest level of service and responsiveness Preferred Experience Experience providing support to CLevel Executives Proficient in working with Google Workspace Slack Zoom Expensify DocuSign and Adobe Pro Experience working with CRM platforms What we value Curious Seek to understand and pull the thread Courageous Takes action even when uncomfortable Lightful Assume positive intent in others Authentic Say what you mean mean what you say act accordingly Bucketworthy Dont let your bucket leak Our Benefits The anticipated salary range for this role is 70000 95000 This role is eligible to participate in our equity incentive and variable bonus plan Actual title and compensation is commensurate with qualifications and experience As a leader in redesigning behavioral health we are walking the walk with our employee benefits We want the experience of working at SonderMind to accelerate peoples careers and enrich their lives so we focus on meeting SonderMinders wherever they are and supporting them in all facets of their life and work Our benefits include A commitment to fostering flexible hybrid work A flexible PTO policy with a minimum of three weeks off Therapy coverage benefits to ensure our employees have access to the care they need Competitive Medical Dental and Vision coverage with plans to meet every need including HSA and FSA options Paid company holidays and a company shutdown during the last week of the year Employerpaid disability  ADD to cover lifes unexpected events Not only that we also cover the difference in salary for up to eight 8 weeks of shortterm disability leave Eight weeks of paid Parental Leave 401K retirement plan with 100 matching on up to 4 of base salary Mental wellness impacts people of every community At SonderMind building and supporting a diverse workforce is foundational to our goal to redesign behavioral healthcare to be more approachable and accessible SonderMind is a committed equal opportunity employer and provides a workplace that will not tolerate discrimination or harassment on the basis of race religion national origin gender identity or expression sexual orientation age marital veteran or disability status

title: Senior Fraud Manager, Europe
description: About the Job Despite the challenges of the pandemic Hopper managed to have tripledigit yearoveryear revenue growth in 2021 In fact with over 70 million downloads Hopper is the fastestgrowing traveltech company and that is driven in large part by the performance of our unique fintech products which offer travelers an unparalleled level of flexibility and control Since 2022 Hopper has been successfully expanding to Europe achieving great results for the business and our users During our business expansion to Europe markets we encountered some significant challenges around fraud including payment fraud and incentive fraud As Senior Fraud Manager Europe you will be overseeing the entirety of antifraud endeavors for the Hoppers growth in Europe which means you will be responsible for implementing and maintaining the tools systems and workflows to identify when fraud occurs and quickly remedy its impact You will be the point person for investigations of suspect fraud attacks for understanding the causes of fraud and for proposing the appropriate immediate and longerterm actions to implement To succeed at Hopper you must have a passion for travel and hospitality love to shop and buy products on your phone and prefer a startup culture to a big company bureaucracy You should be stimulated by growing and empowering your team and enjoy being in the field managing and developing ongoing relationships You should also be ambitious about your career and eager to take on expanded responsibilities as Hopper grows Responsibilities Build up a holistic antifraud mechanism and strategy in support of the entirety of Hoppers Europe expansion Monitor daily business metrics and build dashboards to proactively find new fraud attacks as early as possible and highlight anomalies for deeper forensic investigation Frame and conduct complex exploratory analyses needed to deepen our understanding of Hopper systems and users Use machine learning and big data tools on tremendously large and complex data sets to enhance our fraud detection tools Conduct research into various aspects of our business and employ statistical and modeling techniques when appropriate to make recommendations to nontechnical stakeholders Develop and maintain complex data models turning raw data into analytical datasets Analyze performance identify internal  external trends from data troubleshoot issues identify new opportunities and address ad hoc data requests Draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to technical and nontechnical audiences Work with the central fraud and risk management team to implement the proper antifraud setup to achieve antifraud goals Basic Qualifications Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science Information Systems or a related field 5 years of experience in fraud prevention or a related field Proven experience in building and leading a successful fraud prevention team Experience writing effective narratives Strong communication skills written and verbal Strong ability to source and analyze data including running and modifying SQL queries to investigate anomalies and drive data decisions Should be highly datadriven Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools Google Data Studio and AntiFraud tools like Sift and Riskified An innovative and detailoriented approach to problemsolving Preferred Qualifications Experience in the payment ecommerce or travel industry Knowledge of machine learning techniques and predictive modeling Strong experience writing complex clean and maintainable SQL in a cloud data warehouse environment such as Google Big Query familiarity with data warehousing concepts Kimball etc considered a bonus Experience working in a cloud ecosystem such as GCP or AWS Knowledge of Python ETLdata pipelines is considered a bonus Benefits Wellfunded and proven startup with large ambitions competitive salary and equities stock options RSU Unlimited PTO WeWork All Access Pass OR Workfromhome stipend An entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business Open communication with management and company leadership Small dynamic teams  massive impact Additional Information More about Hopper At Hopper we are on a mission to become the worlds best  and most fun  place to book travel By leveraging massive amounts of data advanced machine learning algorithms Hopper combines its worldclass travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and continues to gain market share globally Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the companys recent growth  Hopper sold around 4 billion in travel and travel fintech in 2022 up nearly 3X over 2021 In 2022 Hopper increased its revenue 25X yearover year  The companys bespoke fintech products such as Flight Disruption Guarantee and Price Freeze now represent 3040 of Hoppers total app revenue  Given the success of its fintech products Hopper launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud in late 2021 Through this partnership program any travel provider airlines hotels banks travel agencies etc can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hoppers fintech or travel inventory As its first Hopper Cloud partnership Hopper partnered with Capital One to codevelop Capital One Travel a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders  Hopper partnered with Capital One to codevelop Capital One Travel a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders  Recognized as one of the worlds most innovative companies by Fast Company four years in a row Hopper has been downloaded over 80 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month  Hopper has raised over 700 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the worlds fastestgrowing mobilefirst travel marketplace Come take off with us

title: Senior Product Designer, Product Growth (Remote)
description: About the job Over the last few years Hopper has evolved and grown from an app which helps consumers save money on flights to a fullservice global travel agency As such our various customers and partners  consumers travel suppliers and advertisers  expect the highest quality product which meets their various objectives The Growth team needs a Sr Product Designer who is experienced driven datadriven and endlessly curious to understand and deliver on the needs of these various constituents and create highquality endsolutions which help meet customer and business objectives through seamless and cohesive UX This Sr Product Designer will work across three product development teams within Growth working on very different problems for different customers These three teams are Retention  Loyalty How can we keep and add more value to our millions of travelers Where can we make their travel booking experience better and implement ways to make Hopper their always goto booking platform App Experience How can we improve several parts of the core user journey  onboarding the trips hub and more  to better meet customer and business objectives Ads How can we design ad experiences which surface relevant content for users while meeting advertiser objectives Responsibilities Deliver solutions with a focus on a great user experience while balancing company goals design cohesion and ease of implementation Own endtoend user journey and all aspects of design execution from ideation to prototyping to usability tests to final product Seek out understand incorporate and communicate qualitative and quantitative feedback throughout the design process leveraging surveys user testing and user data to measure feature performance in app Work autonomously across several crossfunctional product development groups with Product Managers Engineers and Data Scientists to prioritize and build new features Communicate proactively and manage your time really well to meet the objectives of several different roadmaps for different customer and partner segments Have a deep understanding of user needs and business objectives in your agile groups product area Prioritize appropriately use good judgment to make appropriate tradeoffs to speed up product learning and balance competing priorities Minimum Requirements 5 years of experience designing and shipping cross platform iOS and Android consumerfocused products and working with product development teams Experience with Figma and prototyping tools Proven record of designing completely new experiences and endtoend features Ability to own design process endtoend from concept to smoke tests to full implementations including a basic analysis of success measurement with minimal guidance and ambiguity History of leading discovery and ideation and aligning the group around a vision and approach Demonstrated experience in visual design interactive design and prototyping Portfolio showcasing your past work and design process Preferred qualifications Experience as a Lead Product Designer is a bonus Experience with hiring onboarding and improving the teams culture and design approach Experience working at scale with Design Systems Benefits Wellfunded and proven startup with large ambitions competitive salary and stock options Unlimited PTO WeWork All Access Pass OR Workfromhome stipend Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business Open communication with management and company leadership Small dynamic teams  massive impact 100 employer paid medical dental vision disability and life insurance plans Access to a 401k US or Retirement Savings Plan Canada Additional Information posttoexternal MORE ABOUT HOPPER At Hopper we are on a mission to become the worlds best  and most fun  place to book travel By leveraging massive amounts of data advanced machine learning algorithms Hopper combines its worldclass travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and continues to gain market share globally Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the companys recent growth  Hopper sold around 4 billion in travel and travel fintech in 2022 up nearly 3X over 2021 In 2022 Hopper increased its revenue 25X yearover year  The companys bespoke fintech products such as Flight Disruption Guarantee and Price Freeze now represent 3040 of Hoppers total app revenue  Given the success of its fintech products Hopper launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud in late 2021 Through this partnership program any travel provider airlines hotels banks travel agencies etc can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hoppers fintech or travel inventory As its first Hopper Cloud partnership  Hopper partnered with Capital One to codevelop Capital One Travel a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders  Recognized as one of the worlds most innovative companies by Fast Company four years in a row Hopper has been downloaded over 80 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month  Hopper has raised over 700 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the worlds fastestgrowing mobilefirst travel marketplace Come take off with us

title: Product Operations Analyst
description: Hopper offers a remote work policy that empowers employees to work from anywhere Employees have the opportunity to work in an office environment or they can receive a workfromhome stipend if they prefer to work from home About The Role The goal of the Virtual Interlining team is to provide customers with the best flight prices and selection by creating unique flight inventory We are looking for a skilled Product Operations Analyst to join our team as we scale Virtual Interlining to multiple Hopper partners As a Product Operations Analyst you will provide scaled support to our B2B partners and the product development team You will build reporting to monitor the performance of our product use data and customer feedback to diagnose bugs and needed features and work with the product development team to advocate for those fixes and features You will serve as the product expert to answer stakeholder questions and manage communication around the rollout of algorithmic changes and new features We are looking for a highly analytical selfstarter who is excited about the challenge of learning new systems and products The ideal candidate will have experience building reporting and communicating findings to internal and external stakeholders This role will report to the Product Manager and work with a highly skilled team of technical data and productfocused individuals What Your DaytoDay Looks Like Become a subject matter expert in Virtual Interlining to answer stakeholder questions related to bugs and feature launches Monitor the performance of Virtual Interlining across all platforms and share weekly product performance updates with internal and external stakeholders Coordinate the rollout of experiments across tenants and communicate changes to external partners Detect regressions in key metrics and surface to the product development team Manage communication with our B2B partners as needed Dive into the data using SQL and other tools to investigate product and data issues Work with the product development team to strategize solutions to bugs and test fixes once implemented Serve as the primary point person for stakeholder feedback Identify and communicate opportunities for improvement in our product Run tests in app environments to validate issues Maintain high quality documentation of systems processes and settings Thrive on the daytoday collaboration with engineers data scientists and product managers Minimum Qualifications A passion for Hoppers mission to build the most customercentric travel marketplace on Earth Excellent judgment ability to ask smart questions and make quick impactful decisions Highly proficient analytical abilities to draw accurate conclusions from data Ability to communicate clearly with a technical and nontechnical audience Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks at once Experience building reporting such as through ExcelGoogle Sheets Looker Studio Tableau or other BI tools Experience writing SQL Strong ability to grasp and articulate complex systems Technical depth to enable productive collaboration with worldclass engineers and data scientists No ego Strong focus on doing what is right for the customer and the company Preferred Qualifications Experience in product operations or analytics working with product and engineering teams Experience in the travel industry especially air travel Additional Information MORE ABOUT HOPPER At Hopper we are on a mission to become the worlds best  and most fun  place to book travel By leveraging massive amounts of data advanced machine learning algorithms Hopper combines its worldclass travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and continues to gain market share globally Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the companys recent growth  Hopper sold around 4 billion in travel and travel fintech in 2022 up nearly 3X over 2021 In 2022 Hopper increased its revenue 25X yearover year  The companys bespoke fintech products such as Flight Disruption Guarantee and Price Freeze now represent 3040 of Hoppers total app revenue  Given the success of its fintech products Hopper launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud in late 2021 Through this partnership program any travel provider airlines hotels banks travel agencies etc can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hoppers fintech or travel inventory As its first Hopper Cloud partnership  Hopper partnered with Capital One to codevelop Capital One Travel a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders  Recognized as one of the worlds most innovative companies by Fast Company four years in a row Hopper has been downloaded over 80 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month  Hopper has raised over 700 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the worlds fastestgrowing mobilefirst travel marketplace Come take off with us

title: Associate Counsel - Fintech and Cloud
description: Hopper is seeking an experienced international transactional attorney to join its growing global legal team as Associate Counsel for its Fintech and Cloud Business In this role you will report to the Deputy General Counsel and work closely with the growing Fintech and Cloud legal team product leads and other senior business partners to drive and execute commercial contracts with Hoppers B2B partners around the world In doing so you will provide innovative solutions to crossborder remittance issues arising under complex commercial contracts that will govern the provision of Hoppers travel and fintech services to airlines banks and online travel agencies and their respective customers The core function of this role is commercial contracting and the right person will have a strong foundation in withholding tax and indirect tax VATDSTsales tax as a complementary skillset You will be a selfstarter with intellectual curiosity and a willingness to roll up your sleeves and tackle unfamiliar tax issues in new markets to remove blockers and facilitate deal close You will be eager to unpack the complexities needed to close crossborder commercial transactions as a rapidlyscaling B2B business with a home base in Canada and significant operations in the US that operates globally with subsidiaries and affiliates in 38 countries Primary Responsibilities Negotiate draft and close the distributed fintech and Cloud contracts that contribute to Hoppers success Research indirect tax issues in foreign markets to address questions from prospective B2B partners that arise in contracting Devise tax efficient solutions to withholding issues taking into account Hoppers corporate structure Achieve optimal results in B2B contract negotiating across a wide range of legal topics such as intellectual property sanctions compliance payments regulation and data privacy Partner with business development on commercial negotiations Advise product teams on a range of issues in developing innovative product structures including new and emerging legal and regulatory developments impacting Hoppers B2B distribution of fintech products travel portals and website services a new area of growth for Hopper Help scope and build scalable and effective processes for legal review and launch of new products including drafting and maintaining terms and conditions for products sold on Hoppers sites and its B2B partners sites Secondary Responsibilities Advise on all issues affecting Hoppers business globally including consumer protection intellectual property regulatory compliance data privacy and information security and corporate governance Qualifications  Background Requirements JD or LLM in the United States Three 3 years minimum experience in an inhouse position government andor law firm practice advising a wide range of industries including consumer products and technology services on commercial contracting matters including withholding and indirect tax issues Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Experience in reviewing navigating and solving complex crossborder tax issues and in commercial contract drafting Additional Information posttoexternal MORE ABOUT HOPPER At Hopper we are on a mission to become the worlds best  and most fun  place to book travel By leveraging massive amounts of data advanced machine learning algorithms Hopper combines its worldclass travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and continues to gain market share globally Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the companys recent growth  Hopper sold around 4 title: Senior Product Designer, Product Growth (Remote)
description: About the job Over the last few years Hopper has evolved and grown from an app which helps consumers save money on flights to a fullservice global travel agency As such our various customers and partners  consumers travel suppliers and advertisers  expect the highest quality product which meets their various objectives The Growth team needs a Sr Product Designer who is experienced driven datadriven and endlessly curious to understand and deliver on the needs of these various constituents and create highquality endsolutions which help meet customer and business objectives through seamless and cohesive UX This Sr Product Designer will work across three product development teams within Growth working on very different problems for different customers These three teams are Retention  Loyalty How can we keep and add more value to our millions of travelers Where can we make their travel booking experience better and implement ways to make Hopper their always goto booking platform App Experience How can we improve several parts of the core user journey  onboarding the trips hub and more  to better meet customer and business objectives Ads How can we design ad experiences which surface relevant content for users while meeting advertiser objectives Responsibilities Deliver solutions with a focus on a great user experience while balancing company goals design cohesion and ease of implementation Own endtoend user journey and all aspects of design execution from ideation to prototyping to usability tests to final product Seek out understand incorporate and communicate qualitative and quantitative feedback throughout the design process leveraging surveys user testing and user data to measure feature performance in app Work autonomously across several crossfunctional product development groups with Product Managers Engineers and Data Scientists to prioritize and build new features Communicate proactively and manage your time really well to meet the objectives of several different roadmaps for different customer and partner segments Have a deep understanding of user needs and business objectives in your agile groups product area Prioritize appropriately use good judgment to make appropriate tradeoffs to speed up product learning and balance competing priorities Minimum Requirements 5 years of experience designing and shipping cross platform iOS and Android consumerfocused products and working with product development teams Experience with Figma and prototyping tools Proven record of designing completely new experiences and endtoend features Ability to own design process endtoend from concept to smoke tests to full implementations including a basic analysis of success measurement with minimal guidance and ambiguity History of leading discovery and ideation and aligning the group around a vision and approach Demonstrated experience in visual design interactive design and prototyping Portfolio showcasing your past work and design process Preferred qualifications Experience as a Lead Product Designer is a bonus Experience with hiring onboarding and improving the teams culture and design approach Experience working at scale with Design Systems Benefits Wellfunded and proven startup with large ambitions competitive salary and stock options Unlimited PTO WeWork All Access Pass OR Workfromhome stipend Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business Open communication with management and company leadership Small dynamic teams  massive impact 100 employer paid proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and title: Sales Development Representative - Boston, MA
description: Split Software is an industryleading Feature Delivery Platform which enables companies to embrace ImpactDriven Development across their engineering teams We pair the speed and reliability of feature flags with data to measure the impact of every feature By reducing development time mitigating release risk and quantifying impact we free engineering teams to solve customer and business problems You will have the unique opportunity to join Splits growing Sales Development Representative SDR Team and help define a repeatable SDR model that future hires will follow As an SDR you are the teammate who defines every contacts first impression of Split and plays a critical role in driving these initial conversations into opportunities You will be responsible for identifying and qualifying both inbound and outbound leads Split is looking for a hardworking entrepreneurial selfstarter who has excellent communication skills is well organized able to multitask and has prior experience in communicating with both technologists and business executives The ontarget earnings for this role are 75000 annualized with a 55000 base salary and 20000 incentive compensation We Value the Journey Your Days at Split We make the most of every day acting with urgency and determinatio n Educate prospective customers on Split generating qualified leads for the Sales team Use multiple leadgeneration tools to generate outbound calls and emails each day Manage prospects from lead generation through to demo with the ability to articulate value proposition navigate objections and foster relationships Meet and exceed quota of demos and sales qualified leads Define architect and implement plans for acquiring new business We Believe in Bold About You Experimentation is core to our culture  lets iterate til we win Previous experience with proven success in Sales Development Lead Generation andor Sales is a big plus Familiarity with the SDR stack Salesforce Outreach ZoomInfo LinkedIn Navigator or other comparable software platforms Excellent written and verbal communication skills with contacts at all levels of the organization Ability to build strong client relationships and overcome objections over the phone Personable and able to work as a member of small team Able to contribute to projects with peers in other departments when needed A strong work ethic desire to learn and be challenged selfdriven and motivated Eagerness to learn quickly about a new product and industry vertical and to receive constructive feedback to further improve your success in the role Preferred Prior experience in a sales or sales development role for a technical product or with a technical buyer This is a a hybrid inoffice and remote role Candidates need to be located in the Boston area LIHybrid US Pay Range 55000 75000 USD We Row Together Our Culture and Belonging Were all in the same boat with mutual trust and respect We believe an inclusive workplace is critical to the success of our team and our customers We constantly strive to make Split a safe and welcoming place for people from systematically marginalized communities Were looking for teammates that are as passionate as we are and want to join us in doing this extremely important work We believe facetoface inperson communication is invaluable We dont believe that it is the default for everyone We have been fully remote before and our teams continue to grow and span across time zones and countries The heart of our shared culture is virtual  in our lively Slack channels our Zoom company meetings in every photo and highfive shared Our offices act as important vessels for our culture but we are so much more Taking care of our employees is essential to the health of our business We strive to provide a thoughtful and comprehensive total rewards package to support our teammates wellbeing through benefits perks growth opportunities and a strong company culture Why Should You Become a Splitter Competitive salary  equity  Educational reimbursements so you can continue growing personally and professionally Splits remoteinclusive philosophy  giving Splitters the flexibility to work from home or one of our offices located in Redwood City CA Boston MA and Tandil Argentina Our offices are fully stocked with snacks Weve piloted Localized Hubs Stipend for remote teams to foster crosscollaboration and team bonding within their local hubs We offer temporary remote work options to give employees flexibility to work from anywhere We invest in your wellness  Companywide wellness closures so you can take time off to recharge and be your best self EndofYear company closure Flexible PTO  Monthly Wellness Stipend Volunteer Time Off in addition to companywide volunteer events Great health benefits and parental leave Commuter Benefits Additional Perks Patent Incentive Program Employee Referral Bonus Spot Bonus Program Inperson and virtual team events The values that guide our culture We Put Customers at the Center We Row Together We Believe in Bold We Value the Journey Country Specific Details United States Anthem Blue Cross and Kaiser Full Medical dental vision with HSA and FSA options Life Insurance STD and LTD coverage options Reproductive Care Access Travel Benefits Additional Sequoia Wellness programs with OneMedical Carrot and Headspace 10 weeks paid parental leave Fidelity 401k Employee contribution only Argentina You can choose one the following health insurance providers and plans OSDE 310 or Swiss Medical SMG30 Employees and dependants covered at 100 90 days paid maternity leave 10 weeks paid paternity leave English Classes with a Native English Teacher United Kingdom Split pays 100 of the premium for employees and 75 for dependents Private Medical Insurance through BUPA Life Insurance through UNUM Benefit Level x3 annual basic salary Employee Assistance Programme Bereavement Support Service Full InPatient treatment with comprehensive cancer cover and full outpatient Therapies Mental Health Cover Bupa Dental Level 1 Up to 52 weeks of maternity leave 26 OML and 26 AML  refer to the UK Split Handbook for details 10 weeks of paid paternity leave Split 5 pension match Canada Split will comply with all leave requirements per each provincial governments guidance Please visit your specific provincial government website for details Split will ensure parents receive up to 10 weeks of parental leave

title: Privacy Analyst
description: If you have fallen and risen if you have broken and fixed if you have dreamt and built then you have grit Then we speak the same language Welcome to the Wolfpack About CloudWalk We are one of the fastest growing fintechs on the planet We kick ass A unicorn with millions of happy customers a hardcore team and hundreds of millions in funding and revenue But not your typical startup We build and learn fast and we want the hackers the artists the crafters  join the Wolfpack What Youll Be Doing Map the companys personal data processing processes Ensure the updating of the Data Mapping Respond to data subject requests DSR Conduct privacy risk analysis and personal data protection Ensuring the implementation of controls Act on the companys awareness of privacy Review policies Privacy by design and privacy by default Work on updating the incident response plan Work on updating the Data Protection Impact Assessment DPIA What You Need To Succeed Excellent communication skills Excellent communication in Portuguese Communication in advanced English Knowledge of GDPR and LGPD Great analytical capacity Great ability to solve problems Fast learning It will be a plus if you have Previous experience in Privacy and Personal Data Protection Experience and knowledge in information security Basic SQL knowledge Basic programming skills Additional Information We are not expecting candidates to have expertise across all of these areas We will gladly help you bridge the gaps As a member of a fully remote and distributed team you are expected to complete tasks autonomously being highly collaborative and selfdriven Diversity and Inclusion We believe in social inclusion respect and appreciation of all people We promote a welcoming work environment where each CloudWalker can be authentic regardless of gender ethnicity race religion sexuality mobility disability or education

title: Backend Engineer - NodeJS/Typescript (copy)
description: Stuart DPD Group is a sustainable  lastmile logistics company that connects retailers and emerchants to a fleet of geolocalised couriers across several countries in Europe Our Mission  We are an impactdriven company that aims to build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world shared efficient and reliable We are committed to creating a new standard for urban deliveries that meet todays environmental and social challenges while offering a premium delivery experience blending speed flexibility and convenience Our motto Make every delivery a moment all of us can truly celebrate More than 3000 leading brands already partner with us across Restaurants Grocery Retail  Luxury eCommerce and Professional Services to deliver all types of goods at the tap of a button title: Regional Director of Sales
description: Sysdig is driving the standard for securing the cloud and containers We created Falco the open standard for cloudnative threat detection and consistently contribute to open source software projects We are passionate technical problemsolvers continually innovating and delivering powerful solutions to secure the cloud from source to run We value diversity and open dialog to spur ideas working closely together to achieve goals Were an international company that understands how to cultivate a strong culture across a remote team And were a great place to work too  weve been named a Bay Area Best Place to Work by the San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal for three years now We were recognized by Deloitte as one of the 500 fastest growing organizations in 2020 and 2021 We are looking for team members who have a passion for container and cloud security and are willing to dig deeper to help our customers Does this sound like the right place for you Your Opportunity As the Regional Director of Enterprise Sales youll lead a team of experienced Enterprise Field Account Executives responsible for selling container and cloud security solutions to the largest and most innovative customers in the world Reporting to the Area Vice President of Enterprise Sales youll collaborate with Marketing Demand Gen and Inside Sales to drive top of funnel pipeline work with your AE and SE teammates to to help manage and build our business opportunities with a growing portfolio of container Kubernetes and cloud platform security products with enterprise customers The ideal candidate will have a successful track record of meeting and exceeding quotas capturing new logos in an assigned territory mentoring and coaching a sales team What youll do Manage all aspects of the sales process with your sales teams including lead management qualification evaluation close Manage sales pipeline and help mentor and move Opportunities through the sales process Recruit and train Sr Level Account teams Understand the competitive market being familiar with competing companies and their offerings Manage business and track opportunities through CRM and other supporting tools Own and collaborate with other teams in support of your region and sales teams Your background 5 years of enterprise software subscription sales management experience with a track record of closing six and seven figure deals to Fortune 500 companies Force Management Command of the Message Certifications and familiarity with MEDDPICC desired Demonstrable history of recruiting hiring and retaining top talent Domain Expertise with one or more of the following required Cloud Security SaaS sales Open Source Software Container and Kubernetes platforms Monitoring software Strong track record consistently overachieving sales goals Drive to expand client base and close sales Excellent communication skills verbal and written team player Bachelors Degree A sound techsavvy business acumen and the ability to articulate a compelling value proposition in a complex and evolving business environment Ability to thrive in an agile environment with an everevolving set of solutions High technical IQ interpersonal EQ and intellectual curiosity Why work at Sysdig Were a wellfunded startup that already has a large enterprise customer base We have a pragmatic approachable culture from the CEO down We have an organizational focus on delivering value to customers Our opensource tools httpssysdigcomopensource  are widely used and loved by technologists  developers When you join Sysdig you can expect Competitive compensation including equity opportunities Flexible hours and unlimited time off Additional recharge days 401k matching starting the day you do Parental leave and fertility support Health Savings Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts Mental wellbeing support through Modern Health for you and your family Monthly wellness reimbursement Career growth The US annual on target earnings OTE range for this fulltime position is between 350000 and 375000year This range represents a combination of annual base pay and targeted commission Actual offers may be higher or lower than this range based on a variety of factors including but not limited to the candidates work location jobrelated skills experience and education LIKC1

title: VP, Marketing
description: We started Trust  Will in 2017 to make estate planning accessible and affordable for every family Since then weve built an industryleading brand that connects millions of families every year with estate planning and probate tools partners professionals content and services Weve scaled our company with a directtoconsumer brand combined with incredible partnerships with financial advisors institutions and educators Were backed by amazing investors including Jackson Square Ventures Link Ventures Revolutions Rise of the Rest AMEX Northwestern Mutual USAA and more Our business is strong and growing quickly We are very excited to expand our executive team with an experienced growth leader for the next stage of the journey We are looking for somebody who has been the point person on this journey in other highgrowth consumer and fintech startups We are looking for a VP of Marketing to help us build a multigenerational company that helps every family leave their legacy This role is an executive role reporting directly to our COO About You As the VP of Marketing you are the highest marketing executive at Trust  Will We have incredibly high standards for leaders on our team We look for deeply humble emotionally aware outcomeoriented accountable and talented leaders who multiply themselves through incredible team building and efficient communication You should have experience thriving in a remotefirst organization and know how to build worldclass teams You are ultimately responsible for the performance and hitting our high growth goals You will collaborate with all other execs and be part of investor and board conversations Your responsibilities will vary as the company grows Youre responsible for developing and executing our overall marketing strategy to drive revenue scale performance increase brand awareness and promote customer loyalty You will lead a talented marketing team and collaborate closely with crossfunctional teams including product management sales operations and executive leadership This role requires a strategic thinker a creative problem solver and a handson leader who can navigate the rapidly changing technology landscape This role is heavily focused on performance and brand You must understand the intersection of highly scalable digital and traditional performance channels with brand ownership and extensibility Youve scaled multiple other consumer or fintech startups and know what it takes to testlearn and grow budgets across a robust omnichannel effort About the Role Develop and implement the companys marketing strategy aligning it with the overall business goals and objectives Drive brand positioning and messaging to effectively communicate our value proposition to the target audience Lead the development and execution of multichannel marketing campaigns to generate leads acquire customers and drive revenue growth Understand drive and manage scaling TV as a primary channel Manage and optimize digital marketing initiatives including SEO SEM social media email marketing and content marketing Build and manage a highperforming marketing team providing mentorship guidance and performance feedback Marketing Operations while helping us scale the MOPS function at Versapay What youll do Execute and contribute to our email marketing strategyincluding email calendar management email development deployment and performance reporting Maintain a good understanding of email marketing best practices and regulations throughout North America including CASL CCPA and global markets such as GDPR campaign workflows in HubSpot and report on the same Initiate and drive customer and partner marketing campaigns by partnering with the customer events and partner marketing teams Help demand generation by building campaign automation including workflows forms and other automation in support of the marketing and sales teams goals Own marketing reporting enhancements across Salesforce HubSpot and Tableau Analyze gaps in our data and drive practices that help us maintain high quality reliable performance data Build and manage processes to optimize lead routing to the Sales team through tools such as Dataloader Implement and evaluate testing initiatives to improve marketing execution and performance What youll bring to the team Enthusiasm and excitement about growing in the Analytics GTM Google Ads Drift Zapier ZoomInfo and Terminus Passionate about using data to answer critical business questions and drive decisions Experience in campaign orchestration lead nurturing and other marketing automation capabilitiessuch as forms workflows etc 2 years experience with data analysis and visualization tools Tableau Extraordinary attention to detail and problemsolving skills Ability to manage and run multiple concurrent projects within established timelinesusing project management tools such as Asana Great team player and experience working with a diverse group of
